column1: Orekhovo-Borisovo Yuzhnoye District (Russian: райо́н Оре́хово-Бори́сово Ю́жное) is a territorial division (a district
column2: or raion) in Southern Administrative Okrug
column3: one of the 125 in the federal city of Moscow
column4: Russia. It is located in the south of the federal city. The area of the district is 7.197 square kilometers (2.779 sq mi). As of the 2010 Census
column5: the total population of the district was 145

column1: The district is located on the spot of former villages of Orekhovo
column6: mass housing construction was started in the area
column7: and a microdistrict was built there.

column2: the district is incorporated as Orekhovo-Borisovo Yuzhnoye Municipal Okrug.
